German.1: Perform advanced German grammar: the spontaneous production of grammatically correct German in both written and spoken form -- ideally attaining advanced -mid on the ACTFL proficiency scale.
German.2: Grasp German stylistics: the ability to produce written and spoken German in the style appropriate to the context and the targeted audience.
German.3: Grasp the workings of German culture and cultural history: the ability to discuss complex literary and cultural expressions at a sophisticated level, producing, demonstrating, and defending definable arguments.
German.4: Perform proper research methodology: the ability to locate and make productive use of secondary sources, to frame an argument by means of an effective structure.
